security_audit.summary: The architectural-forensics skill is purely documentation-based with no executable code. It provides a systematic methodology for analyzing AI agent frameworks through structured documentation and guidance files. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Deconstruct AI Agent Frameworks for Architecture Insights
content.value_statement: Understanding how existing AI agent frameworks work is crucial for building better systems. This skill provides a systematic methodology to analyze framework architectures, extract reusable patterns, and create reference implementations based on best practices from multiple frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes AI agent framework architectures through systematic documentation review
Extracts engineering patterns (data substrate, execution engine, component model)
Identifies cognitive architecture patterns (control loops, memory, tool interfaces)
Generates comparison matrices across multiple frameworks
Creates anti-pattern catalogs from framework analysis
limitations: Requires manual codebase mapping as prerequisite
Analysis based on documentation patterns, not runtime behavior
Dependent on quality of source code documentation
Framework must be written in Python for pattern recognition

use_cases.title: Framework Selection for New Projects
use_cases.description: Compare multiple agent frameworks to select the best foundation for your AI system based on architectural patterns and trade-offs.

use_cases.title: Custom Agent Framework Design
use_cases.description: Design optimized agent frameworks by extracting best practices from existing implementations while avoiding common pitfalls.

use_cases.title: Technical Due Diligence
use_cases.description: Evaluate agent framework codebases for production readiness, security patterns, and architectural soundness before adoption.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Framework Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the LangChain framework using the minimal path: codebase-mapping ‚Üí execution-engine-analysis ‚Üí control-loop-extraction ‚Üí tool-interface-analysis. Focus on identifying the core architectural patterns and any potential issues.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Framework Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full architectural forensics analysis on AutoGen, CrewAI, and LangGraph. Generate a comparison matrix highlighting their different approaches to memory management, tool interfaces, and multi-agent coordination.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Framework Design
prompt_templates.scenario: Building new framework based on analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze 3-4 agent frameworks to extract best practices for building a new framework optimized for financial trading agents. Focus on error handling, state management, and real-time performance patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Production Readiness Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a comprehensive analysis of the selected framework focusing on resilience patterns, error propagation, sandboxing mechanisms, and security boundaries. Identify any critical issues for production deployment.

output: - Data Substrate: Uses Pydantic models with runtime validation, immutable state patterns via dataclasses
- Execution Engine: Native async/await with DAG-based task execution topology
- Component Model: Thick abstractions with 20+ method base classes, constructor-based DI
- Resilience: Subprocess sandboxing for code execution, 3-tier error propagation with retry logic
- Control Loop: ReAct pattern with explicit Thought-Action-Observation cycles
- Memory: Sliding window context with 10-turn history, vector store for long-term memory
- Tool Interface: Automatic schema generation via function introspection
- Multi-Agent: Supervisor model with central orchestrator managing worker agents
- Strong type safety but potential performance overhead
- Comprehensive error handling with automatic recovery
- Centralized architecture may create bottlenecks for large deployments

best_practices: Run codebase mapping first to ensure comprehensive file discovery before analysis
Use cluster-based reading to understand cross-file architectural patterns rather than analyzing files in isolation
Focus on both engineering chassis (how it runs) and cognitive architecture (how it thinks) for complete understanding
anti_patterns: Don't skip the synthesis phase - generating comparison matrices and anti-pattern catalogs is crucial for actionable insights
Avoid analyzing frameworks in isolation - patterns become clearer when comparing multiple implementations
Don't ignore error handling and resilience patterns - these are critical for production readiness

faq.question: Which frameworks can I analyze?
faq.answer: Any Python-based AI agent framework including LangChain, AutoGen, CrewAI, LangGraph, and custom implementations. The skill recognizes common patterns across different architectures.

faq.question: How long does a full analysis take?
faq.answer: A single framework analysis takes 5-10 minutes. Multi-framework comparisons with synthesis may take 15-30 minutes depending on codebase size and complexity.

faq.question: Can I analyze proprietary frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have local access to the source code. The skill works with any Python codebase regardless of license or origin.

faq.question: What outputs will I get?
faq.answer: You'll receive detailed analysis reports for each framework, comparison matrices, anti-pattern catalogs, and a reference architecture specification synthesizing best practices.

faq.question: How do I resume an interrupted analysis?
faq.answer: The skill automatically tracks progress in state files. Simply re-run the command and it will resume from where it left off, cleaning up any partial results.

faq.question: Can this analyze non-Python frameworks?
faq.answer: Currently optimized for Python frameworks. While some patterns may apply universally, the analysis focuses on Python-specific implementations and conventions.
